WRITING.TITLE: Is Rust a good choice for hosting a GC-ed language?
WRITING.TEXT:
CPython is a runtime written in C. Clojure uses JVM GC. Should I choose Rust for my programming language with GC and threading? Did anybody make a implementation of a GCed language in Rust? Is there a GC implementation itself which I can plug in?
I am leaning towards Java but I want the perfect excuse to choose Rust.
E: Its an dynamically typed, interpreted language. Interpreter works on the AST rather than make bytecode.

I want to make a runtime and have a REPL. So I have to implement a GC too, right?
The HTTP server thing was a distraction. I wanted to reuse the host standard library instead of building one from scratch.
